content: summers in the southeastern united states can be brutally humid and while i ve grown more used to the humidity the longer i ve lived here the weather is exactly why i m drawn to quick knit tops in plant fibers to keep me comfortable while strolling in the sun quetzal is the perfect top for warm days simple twisted stitches dance across the fabric of the work to create the illusion of diamonds throughout knit in luxor the stitches are crisp and it has just the right amount of drape this top is easy to dress up or down wear it on its own for days when the heat is at its peak or layered underneath a cardigan when you need a touch of extra warmth either way this piece will transition you from spring to summer in a snap **this pattern is available in danish at this link 1 ** **sizes** xs s m l xl 1x 2x 3x 4x 5x *shown in small size modeled with 5 inches / 1 5 cm ease* **finished measurements** bust 31 25 34 75 38 41 25 44 75 48 51 25 54 75 58 61 25 inches / 79 5 88 5 96 5 105 113 5 122 130 139 147 5 155 5 cm length 22 22 5 23 23 5 24 25 24 75 25 25 25 75 26 5 26 5 inches / 56 57 58 5 59 5 61 5 63 64 65 5 67 5 67 5 cm **materials** yarn **fibra natura** *luxor* 2 100% mercerized egyptian cotton 137 yds/125 m per 50g color 105-14 tropical green 5 5 6 6 7 7 8 9 9 10 skeins yarn characteristics quetzal is knit using luxor a smooth 100% mercerized egyptian cotton that boasts a lovely sheen and excellent stitch definition recommended needle size *always use a needle size that gives you the gauge listed below -
